description: Create a temporary file or directory.

options.name: --suffix
tip: SUFFIX must not contain a path separator.
This option is implied if TEMPLATE does not end with X.

options.name: --tmpdir
tip: if DIR is not specified, use $TMPDIR ($TMP on windows) if set, else /tmp.
With this option, TEMPLATE must not be an absolute name; unlike with -t, TEMPLATE may contain slashes, but mktemp creates only the final component

options.name: -d
tip: Make a directory instead of a file

options.name: -q
tip: Fail silently if an error occurs.

options.name: -u
tip: do not create anything; merely print a name (unsafe)
